item.title: The three freedoms of the web - Paul Bakaus' blog
item.description: What makes a piece of content, or sub-platform truly open, and part of the open web’s content corpus? This turns out to be a deceivingly hard problem, because everyone I ask replies with a different angle of openness they care about. Over the years, smart folks like Tantek Çelik, Steven Pemberton and Brad Neuberg answered […]

item.title: On The Basics of Modeling
item.description: I had a very interesting chat with a few data science students yesterday. Part of the chat involved the idea of statistical modeling. Throughout the chat, it occured to me that the students didn’t have a very good grasp of what modeling is. To their credit, they were proficient in the techniques of linear regression, and deep learning, but I got the sense that they were very much pushing buttons and watching things happen rather than understanding what they were actually doing.
item.author: (Chewxy)

item.title: Proposal: Association of Security Researchers
item.description: Security researchers play an important role in the industry, though one that doesn’t always receive the support needed. In this post, I am proposing the creation of a new non-profit entity, the International Association of Information Security Research Professionals (IAISRP), as a supporting group to push research forward, and provide the tools and resources to improve the quality of work, and the quality of life for those involved in this vital work.
item.author: (Adam Caudill)

item.title: Qml.Net - BuiltWithDot.Net
item.description:
Qml.Net is cross-platform integration of Qml/QtQuick for Mono/.NET/.NET Core. It is a binding that brings .NET types into JavaScript with full interoperability.
Build fully fledged native graphics-accelerated applications on every desktop platform!

item.title: Microsoft Releases .NET 6 Preview 1
item.description: Last week, Microsoft released the first preview of .NET 6. The new version of the framework represents the final steps of the .NET unification plan that started with .NET 5, providing a cross-platform open-source platform for all things .NET. This first preview brings performance improvements and features such as WPF support for ARM64, support for Apple Silicon, and a redesigned thread pool.
item.author:
(Arthur Casals
Follow)

item.title: JavascriptUtils.NodeJS - BuiltWithDot.Net
item.description: JavascriptUtils.NodeJS provides ways to invoke javascript in NodeJS, from .Net applications. On top of providing a way to invoke javascript from .js files on disk, JavascriptUtils.NodeJS provides ways to invoke in-memory Javascript in string or Stream form, as well as logic in the NodeJS cache.

item.title: Parsing floating-point numbers really fast in C#
